description: A delightful and wholesome snack or dessert made from mashed sweet potatoes, shaped into balls, and lightly pan-fried until golden, then rolled in a warm, aromatic honey glaze. A perfect blend of natural sweetness and comforting texture.

cultural_significance.cultural_notes: While not a deeply traditional dish, this recipe creatively uses two beloved and widely available Ugandan ingredients: sweet potatoes (viazi vitamu) and honey (asali). It represents a modern, home-cooked approach to creating nutritious and appealing snacks, especially for children. It fits perfectly within the local palate that enjoys natural sweets and starchy comforts.

sweet_potato_balls.name: Cornstarch or All-Purpose Flour
sweet_potato_balls.local_name: Unga wa Starch / Unga wa Ngano

steps.instruction: Place the peeled and cubed sweet potatoes in a pot and cover with water. Boil for 15-20 minutes until very tender. Drain thoroughly.
Transfer the drained sweet potatoes to a mixing bowl and mash them until completely smooth. Allow to cool for 10-15 minutes.
Add the cornstarch (or flour), cinnamon, and salt to the cooled mashed sweet potato. Mix until a soft, workable dough forms. If it's too sticky, add a little more cornstarch.
With lightly oiled hands, take portions of the dough and roll them into smooth, bite-sized balls, about 1 inch (2.5 cm) in diameter.
Heat 3 tablespoons of vegetable oil in a non-stick skillet over medium heat. Place the sweet potato balls in the skillet, ensuring they don't touch.
Pan-fry the balls for 5-7 minutes, turning them frequently with a spatula, until they are golden brown on all sides.

cooking_indicators.visual: Golden brown and slightly firm on the outside
cooking_indicators.texture: Crisp exterior, soft and hot inside

steps.instruction: Remove the balls from the skillet and set them aside on a plate. Reduce the heat to low.
In the same skillet, add the butter, honey, lemon juice, and water. Stir continuously for 1-2 minutes until the mixture is bubbly and has slightly thickened into a thin syrup.
Return the fried sweet potato balls to the skillet. Gently toss and roll them in the honey glaze for about a minute until they are evenly coated and glossy.
Turn off the heat. Immediately transfer the honeyed sweet potato balls to a serving plate. Sprinkle with toasted sesame seeds while still sticky.

serving_suggestions: Serve warm as a dessert or a sweet snack. They are delicious on their own or with a scoop of vanilla ice cream or plain yogurt.
